New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 1 月 30 日星期二 04:11:46 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Far North family nearly drown at Coopers Beach, teen grateful to swimmer who saved her https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-family-nearly-drowns-at-coopers-beach-grateful-to-swimmer-who-saved-them/LNJPNWGJLFHQLDXHB4LVVSXCKY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-family-nearly-drowns-at-coopers-beach-grateful-to-swimmer-who-saved-them/LNJPNWGJLFHQLDXHB4LVVSXCKY/ Avneesh VincentThe rescuer was only at the beach that day because his son asked him to go there. Tue, 30 Jan 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Bonnie Parrish (right) thanks her rescuer Rob Higham for saving her life after she nearly drowned at Coopers Beach last week.
Gnomes homeless: Hastings police uncover stash of outdoor ornaments after spate of garden thefts https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/gnomes-homeless-hastings-police-uncover-stash-of-outdoor-ornaments-after-spate-of-garden-thefts/CHKQO5ODNBFGFNX2JW2S4HFZ7A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/gnomes-homeless-hastings-police-uncover-stash-of-outdoor-ornaments-after-spate-of-garden-thefts/CHKQO5ODNBFGFNX2JW2S4HFZ7A/ On entering the property, police came face to face with an elephant ornament. Tue, 30 Jan 2024 03:39:42 +0000 A woman has been charged with three counts of burglary after police stumbled across a stash of what they claim are stolen gnomes.
Hamilton man guilty of throwing petrol at police, despite their ‘woeful investigation’ - judge https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hamilton-man-guilty-of- throwing-petrol-at-police-despite-their-woeful-investigation-judge/C3X2K3YTFFGLVBSSPO7UASMC6M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hamilton-man-guilty-of- throwing-petrol-at-police-despite-their-woeful-investigation-judge/C3X2K3YTFFGLVBSSPO7UASMC6M/ Belinda FeekA fire was burning in front of the two officers when petrol was poured on them. Tue, 30 Jan 2024 03:00:00 +0000 Richard Greenland, 41, had already thrown petrol over himself when he then ran towards two police officers and threw petrol at them too. Photo / NZME

Four-week-old Auckland Zoo tiger cub euthanised after sustaining head injury, habitat closed to visitors https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/four-week-old-auckland-zoo-tiger-cub-euthanished-after-sustaining-head-injury-habitat-close-to-visitors/PZ6SHJGQEBACZBIKTYDUH4BJ6M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/four-week-old-auckland-zoo-tiger-cub-euthanished-after-sustaining-head-injury-habitat-close-to-visitors/PZ6SHJGQEBACZBIKTYDUH4BJ6M/ Benjamin PlummerThe Sumatran tiger cub was exploring its habitat on Saturday when the incident happened. Tue, 30 Jan 2024 02:54:48 +0000 A Sumatran tiger cub born to Zayana at Auckland Zoo in early January has been euthanised after it sustained a head injury over the weekend. Photo / Auckland Zoo
